thread.title: High school roundup: Galway's Deb Wilday gets 300th girls' soccer victory
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Galway's Deb Wilday gets 300th girls' soccer victory - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Galway's Deb Wilday gets 300th girls' soccer victory
text:
Griffin Gannon and Caroline Conti scored to lead Galway to a 2-0 win over Duanesburg in a Western Athletic Conference girls' soccer match and give coach Deb Wilday her 300th coaching victory.
Gannon scored on a penalty kick in the first half. Conti netted an insurance marker in the second half on a cross from Grace Montague .
It was enough to give Wilday, who has coached girls' soccer and basketball at Galway for more than 30 years, the win. She earned her 300th coaching victory in girls' basketball last year.
"It feels good," Wilday said. "They are a nice group of girls."
Field hockey: Liz Ryan scored a pair of first-half goals and host Hoosick Falls remained unbeaten with a 2-0 win over Greenwich in a Wasaren/ Adirondack League contest. Cassie Sherman stopped five shots to record the shutout for the Panthers, who improved to 14-0 overall and 11-0 in the league. The Witches (12-3, 9-2) got 11 saves from Olivia Barnes . ... Mimi Liebers scored Saratoga Springs' first two goals and the Blue Streaks went on to a 4-0 Suburban Council win over Shaker. Saratoga Springs (9-4, 8-4) also got a goal and an assist from Maggie Conway .
Girls' soccer: Junior Louise Metz had a hat trick to lead Doane Stuart past New Lebanon, 5-0, in a Central Hudson Valley League contest. Metz has scored six goals in her past two games as she also netted a hat trick on Wednesday in a 6-0 victory over Rensselaer. ... Albany Academy for Girls got second-half goals from Camryn Fischer and Natalie Tulchinsky to rally from a 1-0 halftime deficit and post a 2-1 Colonial Council victory over Ichabod Crane . The Riders (6-7-1) got their goal from Becky Wallin . Nivya Menakura had 15 saves for the Bears.
Boys' soccer: Jared Gregorek snapped a 1-1 deadlock with a goal in the second half and lifted Schuylerville to a 2-1 victory over Glens Falls in a Foothills Council game. Schuylerville climbed to 8-4. ... Teddy Bruschini scored a hat trick and Ben Wilson recorded his seventh shutout of the season with three saves as South Glens Falls routed Hudson Falls 11-0 in a Foothills Council contest. The Bulldogs improved to 11-3 overall and 10-2 in the league. The Tigers dropped to 4-10 and 3-10.
